title: Customizing Your Inbox: Date Ranges
content: If you’d like to have your Gmail inbox operating more like Outlook or Yahoo (where emails are grouped by custom date ranges), look no further than the Multiple Inbox functionality. Instructions Login to your Gmail account in your web browser of choice. Select the ⚙️ in the upper, right-hand corner of your inbox. Select the See all settings from the right-hand side panel that appears. Once within all settings, click Inbox. Select Multiple Inbox from within the Inbox type drop-down menu. Within the custom query section, place your parameters thus: [CODE] newer_than:1d label:inbox | Today older_than:1d newer_than:2d label:inbox | Yesterday older_than:2d newer_than:7d label:inbox | This Week older_than:7d newer_than:31d label:inbox | This Month older_than:31d label:inbox | Older[Image] In the Multiple inbox position option, select where you want to see these subdividers appear. (You’d like prefer to see them above your aggregated inbox, but can also select to place them below or to the right of your aggregated inbox). When finished, scroll to the bottom of the settings and click Save Changes You can use this customization for any query that supports how you like to do work--not just date ranges. Need to be able to quickly view things from certain people? Change the search query and section name accordingly. For more information on your options, check out Google’s query documentation.
